node.display_long_description:
Let the music move you in Synth Riders, a freestyle dance rhythm game with official custom song support and a thriving community!

>> Demo available on App Lab <<

• Dance to 55 songs of various genres
• Enjoy official custom song support (on the primary account)
• Discover DLCs including Muse and The Offspring
• Meet 10 friends in cross-platform multiplayer
• Experience 360° Spin Mode in every song
• Burn those calories with a fitness smartwatch

“An amazing full-body physical experience” 
- VR Fitness Insider

“An excellent, freestyling alternative to other VR rhythm games” 
- Android Central

The trailer presents the Experience for "Come Out and Play" by The Offspring. It is a DLC available for $1.99 or as a part of the "Adrenaline" Music Pack.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
The “Out Of This World” Update!
Stages, Avatars, Multiplayer, Visuals & Custom Experiences

From the bright neon of The Rooftop in Spin City, Synth Riders goes out of this world, touching down on the surface of The Planet!  Spaceships soar and walkers stride around the base during the totality of an Eclipse.  Gorgeous new visuals, an enhanced multiplayer room for more interaction possibilities to coincide with the introduction of Oculus Avatars, Custom Experiences, a reimagining of “Spin City” and a brand new spin stage called “Eclipse” await you in this update - along with much, much more!

SPIN STAGE & HOME STAGE UPDATES
- Enjoy a brand new Spin Stage, “Eclipse” which takes you to another planet far, far away - where robots roam and spaceships rule the skies.	
- Our existing “Spin City” stage has been completely redesigned, adding a new level of richness and depth never before seen in Synth Riders.
- Both these stages are also available for selection in standard play mode, or as your Home Stage (Settings > Visuals > Home Stage) as "The Rooftop" & "The Planet".

OCULUS AVATARS FOR MULTIPLAYER ROOMS (QUEST & RIFT ONLY)
- Oculus avatars now available for players on Oculus devices who have them configured!  Select and customize your Oculus avatar, enable it through Settings > Visuals > Avatars before entering Multiplayer and then take it for a spin!  Unfortunately these are not cross platform, which means your Oculus avatar will only be seen by other Oculus players.
- When playing the Oculus version of the game on PC, the Oculus avatars and the in-game avatar system are incompatible, enabling one will disable the other.
- Due to performance constraints of Oculus Avatars in large numbers, we have locked the refresh rate in multiplayer rooms down to 72Hz when they are in use in order to give as much performance as possible on Quest.
- The Settings > Multiplayer > Multiplayer Avatars option allows you to show your Oculus Avatar to other players, while only showing you their presence as a Synth Riders avatar.  This setting removes the 72Hz restriction on multiplayer lobbies, useful for those who experience discomfort in lower refresh rates, while still allowing you to interact.

AN IMPROVED MULTIPLAYER EXPERIENCE
- Players can now teleport around in the Multiplayer room, which is now a shared space!  Just point to an empty hex where you wish to go and pull the trigger to jump!
- More intuitive interactions with other players are now possible, as avatars reflect your movements and positions correctly relative to the room and each other!
- Player name tags will always face towards you, and a speaking icon appears above the name tag to make it easier to know who’s speaking when not looking at the board.  Voice chat in the lobby also includes spatialized audio to help you know who’s talking.
- Player platforms are also closer together, so step towards a player if you want to interact more closely, or just stay in the centre of your hex if you prefer to keep your social distance!
- If you find crowds a little overwhelming, you can always find a clear space in “The Room”.  Go to Settings > Visuals > Home Stage and select “The Room” and “Load Stage” to enjoy the voice chat only experience from the comfort of your futuristic apartment!
- Room hosts can now mute a player for the whole room at once using Global Mute. A less severe option than a ban, great where someone has a malfunctioning microphone, or where you need to take control of a situation. Hosts can just return to the Multiplayer Room and select the cog next to the player's name to see the new option.
 
QUEST PERFORMANCE - 120Hz MODE AVAILABLE, IMPROVEMENTS FOR QUEST 1
- A new setting in Settings > Visuals > Advanced Graphics Options to allow Quest 2 players to change their display refresh rate.  For players with the 120Hz option enabled in Experimental Features, you can use this to enable 120Hz mode.  Please note that this setting will not apply in a multiplayer room when you have Oculus Avatars enabled - at present under these conditions, the refresh rate is locked to 72Hz while in the room, and will unlock during song play.
- Significant improvements to performance and memory use throughout the UI which give a better experience for players on Quest 1.
- Oculus MRC (Mixed Reality Capture) is re-enabled.
- Fixed behavior for Settings > Visuals > Advanced Settings > Text Antialiasing > 2x.  New default is set to 4x for better visuals on Quest 1.
- In-game news displays relevant images again for Quest players.
 
PCVR HIGH QUALITY GRAPHICS OPTIONS
- The regular Synth Avatars get a polish on PCVR with a shiny new skin!
- The Glow Is Back!  Additional “Beautify” Settings for PCVR players!  Use Settings > Visuals > Effects: Neon Bloom - turn on / off and control the level of the neon bloom effect	
- Settings > Visuals > Effect Display: Neon Bloom Effect - control whether the effect is displayed in headset and/or on screen
- Settings > Visuals > Advanced Settings > Neon Bloom Quality - control the quality of the post processing effects applied
 
OTHER GRAPHIC AND VISUAL IMPROVEMENTS
- New "Contrast Corridor" option under Settings > Gameplay determines whether to display a dark contrast corridor in the line of play to improve visibility on some stages.
- When using spin stages outside of Spin Mode, the spin mode emitter will always remain present as a contrast panel in front of the note origin to aid visibility.
- Minor cosmetic changes to The Pit & The Void home stages and Glitch stage.
- Improved visuals in the Multiplayer results screen for Quest.

CUSTOM STAGE CHANGES & CUSTOM EXPERIENCES
- The long-awaited Custom Experiences are now available for creators!  More documentation on how to set up and use this feature is listed separately here: https://bit.ly/srcustomexp, please join us on the official discord (discord.synthridersvr.com) to share and learn!
- Custom Stages are now cached, extra information is available in-game about them, and they will be reloaded when you reload your custom songs!   To accommodate these new features, a new custom stage template has been released for this version onwards, available here: https://bit.ly/srcustomtemplate.  Our stage makers are encouraged to migrate to this new template for all new stages.
- Removed an extra offset which was added to custom stages (thanks Gruntled).
 
TWITCH INTEGRATION IMPROVEMENTS (PCVR ONLY)
- QUEUE & HISTORY labels were missing for "The Pit" home stage (both Multiplayer & Solo play).
- Global cooldowns (any user any feature and this user any feature) don't apply to !srr and !oops anymore.
- Added sorting history in reverse order, changed history to sort by time deleted instead of time requested.
- Disabled bot reply to cheers when invaderz are disabled.
 
BUG FIXES AND IMPROVEMENTS
- New option in Settings > Calibration to allow players to customize the position of the controller orbs.
- Volume control on the song selection menu and multiplayer lobby are now in 5% increments	
- Note values display correctly in the song select screen.
- Exit button & platform clock visuals improved.
- OST songs with Experiences are now easier to identify with a “EXP” slash on the album cover.
- Settings > Visuals > Advanced Settings menu cleaned up, Calibration and bHaptics menu cleaned up on Quest.
- On the main screen you can use Tab to disable the In-Game News panel, then again to disable the game UI, and then another will bring it all back. (PCVR ONLY)
- Sort & Filter results persist through song plays.
- Fixed an issue where the spin emitter would show over the pause menu.		
- Fixed an issue where if a playlist loaded had an error, all playlists were deleted (thanks Whipstickgostop).
- Pausing a song while in multiplayer and failing while still in pause will no longer leave you forever playing.
- Song hash is now the only option used to determine whether all players have the same custom song for Multiplayer. Previously, this would failover to a song ID. This will prevent players from playing with different maps in the same game.
- Players with 0 score in multiplayer no longer vanish from the HUD at end, and if all players score 0, no longer generates a blank summary screen.
- Fixed an issue around LIV fade out/in on scene transitions for avatar and mixed reality.

A huge shout out to our beta testers who signed up and joined us to test!  You are all amazing - thank you for being a part of this, enjoy sharing it with the world!

As always we welcome your feedback and bug reports on our Official Discord server (Invite: http://discord.synthridersvr.com) or in the Synth Riders Official Community on Facebook.

If you want to support the development of Synth Riders, we really appreciate reviews left on the Steam/Oculus Store!

node.display_short_description: Dance all night and never run out of tunes with the ultimate collection including 20 songs, 2 stages, and 2 experiences, from Muse to The Offspring to Parov Stelar!

nodes.title: Oculus Avatars, Multiplayer Improvements, New Stages!
nodes.body_text:
We are happy to present the new major update with many exciting features and improvements:

Oculus Avatars for Multiplayer room
Oculus Avatars are now available for players on all Oculus devices. Customize your avatar before entering Multiplayer, and then, take it for a spin!
 
New stages for Spin Mode
Enter “Eclypse”, a brand new stage for the Spin Mode that will take you to another planet where robots roam and spaceships rule the skies! The existing “Spin City” stage has been completely redesigned for a new level of richness and depth.
 
Improved multiplayer experience
You can teleport around in the Multiplayer room, which is now a shared space! You will experience better interactions thanks to avatars’ movements and position.
 
Major performance improvements
On Oculus Quest 2, you can now turn on an experimental 120Hz Mode! On Quest 1, we are introducing significant improvements to performance and memory use.
 
You are invited to join our Community on Discord and leave a review on the Oculus Store to support the development.

A huge shout out to our beta testers who signed up and joined us to test!  You are all amazing - thank you for being a part of this, enjoy sharing it with the world!
 
See you in the game!

nodes.title: "Adrenaline" feat. The Offspring is now out!
nodes.body_text:
Rock out to The Offsprings!

The "Adrenaline" Music Pack is now available featuring 8 new songs!

This new pack will have you jumping straight into the mosh pit with the greatest hits of iconic punk rock artists including The Offspring, Bad Religion, and Rancid. The pack comes with 3 free songs and 5 paid DLC songs.

The song “Come Out And Play” by The Offspring comes bundled with the second Synth Riders Experience, this time packed with punk style and rock attitude tailored to match the track with perfectly synced visuals.

Check out a trailer for the new Experience.

Free songs are already in your library! DLC songs can be purchased for $1.99 or as a bundle with a 20% discount.

You are invited to join our Community on Discord and leave a review on the Oculus Store to support the development.

See you in the game!

node.reviewDescription:
Title says it... I don't know why I waited so long.

I've tried the beat saber demo and the synth riders demo. First time playing the synth riders demo, I thought okay... this is really cool... like really cool. But... I didn't like the music much, even the DLC packs, just not a fan of it. BTW, the game comes with at least like 30-50+ songs that are free... so there's quite a lot.

Now, on to why I finally decided to buy it... I discovered you can add custom songs, so I was like okay, I'm sold! I'll give it a shot and see what songs they have. Holy crap, I've found so many songs that are fun to play and picked up on it instantly. 

What started off as just feeling the "rhythm" or "punching" notes, instantly transformed into playing songs, and FULL ON dancing. I don't even dance, but I found myself playing more and more songs dancing to it. You'll actually notice some of the mapped songs have choreography that goes with them, which makes it so exciting. Some examples would be "Taylor Swift's - Shake it off" or "Bee Gees - Stayin alive" where you're literally doing that dance move pointing your fingers/hands up and down like you're in a boogie disco. 

In conclusion, don't sleep on this game, and buy it already.

I used to have some daily games that I would play everyday, and this completely took over everything. I found myself playing every chance I can get, bingeing on new songs.

Tips for new players...
- Get the custom songs (look for top voted songs, and make sure they have your difficulty you're comfortable with. normal/hard (and even expert) should be okay for most people
- Turn on NO FAIL mode. After you get better, just turn it off later. 
- After you have "no fail" mode on, just focus on playing and not "winning". You don't have to hit every note. Learn to go with the rhythm, and just play it to have fun. You'll quickly find yourself dancing and not playing.
- Master tracks may seem hard, but they're all not that hard. Just play them if it's a song you like.
node.reviewTitle: I don't know why I waited so long!...

website_page_meta.description: Synth Riders is a freestyle dancing rhythm alternative with official custom song support. Lose yourself in the incredible music, meet friends in the multiplayer, and get a good workout in the process!
website_page_meta.title: Synth Riders · Oculus Quest
